alert.note: Alert for Twin Falls (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 25 at 11:09AM MDT until May 25 at 9:15PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of south central Idaho and southwest Idaho, including the following counties, in south central Idaho, Twin Falls. In southwest Idaho, Owyhee. * WHEN...Until 300 PM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1109 AM MDT, Thunderstorms producing heavy rainfall will develop across the advisory area through this evening. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rogerson, Salls Crossing, Crawfish Crossing, Juniper Butte, Middle Butte, Three Creek, Murphy Hot Springs, Poison Butte, Black Butte, Coonskin Butte, Clover Butte, Sevy Falls, Cedar Creek Reservoir, Black Rock Mountain, Black Rock Crossing, Bruneau River Launch Site, China Mountain, Black Stone Mountain, Monument Butte and Salmon Falls Reservoir. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
